group_siblings.title: The Care and Use of Slip Gauges

results.title: Micrometer calipers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
The principle of the micrometer is explained in detail, its spindle with a thread of a pitch of 1/40th of an inch, the thimble, the adjustable nut and sleeve, the frame and the anvil, graduated line of the sleeve, graduations on the thimble. Stress is laid on the importance of careful maintenance and cleaning, and regular checks for accuracy of this instrument.

results.title: Locking devices
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
Starts by showing diagrammatically the effect of vibration on a nut and bolt to draw attention to the necessity for some way of preventing the nut coming undone. Various devices for this purpose are demonstrated.

results.title: Files and filing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Engineering”.
The correct method of use and the difficulties to be overcome in order to fall into the way of making straight, level strokes when filing, whether it be heavy, light or ordinary filing. Different kinds of files are demonstrated including methods of cleaning files, and finally, the importace of practice by the student or trainee is stressed.

results.title: Getting anxious
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Everyone suffers from anxiety occasionally but for 10% of the community anxiety can lead to helpless panic which prevents them from participating in everyday life. This program studies the effects of different types of panic disorders and, using interviews with patients, discusses the different types of treatment available.

results.title: Summing up
results.creator_credit: Bryan Bruty, Mark Hamlyn and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Huw Evan presents this final program in the series, in which experts with varying concerns and criticisms about the treatment of psychiatric disorders confront two psychiatrists. Each topic is illustrated by excerpts from the previous programs. Some of the issues discussed are the use of electro-convulsive therapy, treatment with drugs and enforced hospitalisation.

results.title: Putting people away
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Psychiatrists have the responsibility for deciding who should and who shouldn’t be locked away, whose behaviour is merely eccentric and who is in fact, mentally ill. This program looks at the effect on people’s civil liberties when they are forcibly detained and questions whether it is necessary for the mentally ill to be hospitalised at all.
